00010 #include "jcom.hub.h"

00017 struct _byName : binary_function<t_preset*, t_preset*, bool> {
00018         bool operator()(const t_preset* p, const t_preset* q)
00019                 {       return p->name == q->name; }
00020 } presetByName;
00021  
00022 struct _byNum : binary_function<t_preset*, long, bool> {
00023         bool operator()(const t_preset* p, const long q)
00024                 {       return p->number == q; }
00025 } presetByNumber;
00026 
00030 struct _presetIsLess : binary_function<t_preset*, t_preset*, bool> {
00031         bool operator()(const t_preset* p, const t_preset* q)
00032                 {       return p->number < q->number; }
00033 } presetIsLess;
00034 
00035 void hub_preset_copy(t_hub *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)  // number or name
00036 {
00037         presetList              *preset = x->preset;
00038         
00039         if(argc < 1){
00040                 error("jcom.hub (%s module): preset.recall requires a valid argument", x->attr_name);
00041                 return;
00042         }
00043         
00044         presetListIterator pIter;
00045         bool found = false;
00046         if(argv->a_type == A_SYM) {
00047                 for(pIter = preset->begin(); pIter != preset->end(); ++pIter) {
00048                         if((*pIter)->name == argv->a_w.w_sym) {
00049                                 found = true;
00050                                 break;
00051                         }
00052                 }
00053         } else {
00054                 long presetNum = atom_getlong(argv);
00055                 for(pIter = preset->begin(); pIter != preset->end(); ++pIter) {
00056                         if((*pIter)->number == presetNum) {
00057                                 found = true;
00058                                 break;
00059                         }
00060                 }                       
00061         }
00062         
00063         t_symbol* presetsName = NULL;
00064         if(found) {
00065                 t_preset *presetCopy = (t_preset*)sysmem_newptr((sizeof(t_preset)));
00066                 // Get name to use for the newly created preset
00067                 if(argc > 1) 
00068                         presetsName = atom_getsym(argv+1);
00069                 else 
00070                         presetsName = symbol_unique();  // make one up
00071 
00072                 critical_enter(0);
00073                 sysmem_copyptr(*pIter, presetCopy, sizeof(t_preset));
00074                 presetItemList  *item = (*pIter)->item;
00075                 presetCopy->number = preset->size() + 1;  // place copied preset at end of preset list
00076                 presetCopy->item = new presetItemList(*item);
00077                 presetCopy->name = presetsName;
00078                 preset->merge(presetCopy, presetIsLess);  // add to list of presets
00079                 critical_exit(0);
00080                 hub_preset_buildmenu(x);
00081         } else {
00082                 error("jcom.hub (%s module): preset to copy not found", x->attr_name);
00083         }
00084         
00085 }
00086                         
00087         
00088         
00089 void hub_preset_recall(t_hub *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)        // number or name
00090 {
00091         presetList              *preset = x->preset;
00092         presetItemList  *item;
00093         bool                    found = false;
00094         short                   num_items_with_priority = 0;
00095         short                   num_items_recalled = 0;
00096         short                   i;
00097         
00098         if(argc < 1){
00099                 error("jcom.hub (%s module): preset.recall requires a valid argument", x->attr_name);
00100                 return;
00101         }
00102 
00103         presetListIterator pIter;
00104         critical_enter(0);      
00105         // Search the linked list of presets for the specified preset by name
00106         if(argv->a_type == A_SYM){
00107                 for(pIter = preset->begin(); pIter != preset->end(); ++pIter) {
00108                         if((*pIter)->name == argv->a_w.w_sym) {
00109                                 found = true;
00110                                 break;
00111                         }
00112                         //pIter = preset->find_if(preset->begin(), preset->end(), presetByName);
00113                         //found = pIter != preset->end() ? true : false;
00114                 }
00115         }
00116         else{
00117                 long preset_num = atom_getlong(argv);
00118                 for(pIter = preset->begin(); pIter != preset->end(); ++pIter) {
00119                         if((*pIter)->number == preset_num) {
00120                                 found = true;
00121                                 break;
00122                         }
00123                         //pIter = preset->find_if(pIter, preset->end(), presetByNumber);
00124                         //found = pIter != preset->end() ? true : false;
00125                 }
00126         }
00127         
00128         if(!found){
00129                 if(x->attr_name != gensym("/editing_this_module"))
00130                         error("jcom.hub (%s module): preset.recall - invalid preset specified", x->attr_name->s_name);
00131                 critical_exit(0);
00132                 return;
00133         }
00134         
00135         // Store the number of the preset we recalled last in the first preset (the one being recalled now)
00136         (*(x->preset->begin()))->last_preset_num = (*pIter)->number;
00137         // Store the name as well
00138         (*(x->preset->begin()))->last_preset_name = (*pIter)->name;
00139         // Now take our preset items and send them out!
00140         item = (*pIter)->item;
00141         presetItemListIterator itemIterator;
00142         for(itemIterator = item->begin(); itemIterator != item->end(); ++itemIterator) {
00143                 if((*itemIterator)->priority)
00144                         num_items_with_priority++;
00145         }
00146 
00147         t_preset_item *presetItem;
00148         if(num_items_with_priority > 0){
00149                 i=1;
00150                 while(num_items_with_priority > num_items_recalled){
00151                         for(itemIterator = item->begin(); itemIterator != item->end(); ++itemIterator) {
00152                                 presetItem = *itemIterator;
00153                                 if(presetItem->priority == i) {
00154                                         hub_symbol(x, presetItem->param_name, presetItem->list_size,
00155                                                 &(presetItem->value_list[0]));
00156                                         num_items_recalled++;
00157                                 }
00158                         }
00159                         i++;
00160                 }
00161                 // Recall items with priority 0 now
00162                 for(itemIterator = item->begin(); itemIterator != item->end(); ++itemIterator) {
00163                         presetItem = *itemIterator;
00164                         if(presetItem->priority == 0)
00165                                 hub_symbol(x, presetItem->param_name, presetItem->list_size, &(presetItem->value_list[0]));
00166                 }               
00167         }
00168         else{
00169                 for(itemIterator = item->begin(); itemIterator != item->end(); ++itemIterator) {
00170                         presetItem = *itemIterator;
00171                         if(presetItem->priority == 0)
00172                                 hub_symbol(x, presetItem->param_name, presetItem->list_size, &(presetItem->value_list[0]));
00173                 }
00174         }
00175         critical_exit(0);
00176 }
00177 
00178 t_preset* find_preset(presetList *presetll, t_symbol* name)
00179 {
00180         presetListIterator pIter;
00181         presetItemListIterator itemIterator;
00182         t_preset* p;
00183         //presetList *presetll = x->preset;
00184                 
00185         for(pIter = presetll->begin(); pIter != presetll->end(); ++pIter) {
00186                 p = *pIter;
00187                 if(p->name == name)
00188                         return p;
00189         }
00190         
00191         return NULL;
00192 }
00193 
00194 void interpolate_presets(t_hub *x, t_preset *p1, t_preset *p2, float position)
00195 {
00196         presetItemList *itemOneList, *itemTwoList;
00197         itemOneList = p1->item; itemTwoList = p2->item;
00198         t_preset_item *item1, *item2;
00199         float value;
00200         t_atom newValue[LISTSIZE];
00201         bool found = false;
00202         
00203         presetItemListIterator i1, i2;
00204         for(i1 = itemOneList->begin(), i2 = itemTwoList->begin(); i1 != itemOneList->end() 
00205                 && i2 != itemTwoList->end(); ++i1, ++i2) {
00206                 
00207                 item1 = *i1; item2 = *i2;
00208 
00209                 if(item1->param_name != item2->param_name) {
00210                         // parameter names don't match find the parameter
00211                         found = false;
00212                         for(i2 = itemTwoList->begin(); i2 != itemTwoList->end(); ++i2) {
00213                                 item2 = *i2;
00214                                 if(item1->param_name != item2->param_name)
00215                                         continue;
00216                                 else {
00217                                         found = true;
00218                                         // if params are out of order we need reset list two to the beginning
00219                                         i2 = itemTwoList->begin();
00220                                         break;
00221                                 }
00222                         }
00223                 } else
00224                         found = true;
00225                 
00226                 // couldn't find parameter, skip it
00227                 if(!found) {
00228                         i2 = itemTwoList->begin();
00229                         continue;
00230                 }
00231                 
00232                 // we can assume item1 and item2 are the same type if they are the same parameter (see above)
00233                 if(item1->type == ps_msg_int) {
00234                         value = atom_getfloat(&item1->value_list[0]) * (1. - position) + atom_getfloat(&item2->value_list[0]) * position;
00235                         atom_setfloat(&newValue[0], value);
00236                 } else if(item1->type == ps_msg_float) {
00237                         value = atom_getfloat(&item1->value_list[0]) * (1. - position) + atom_getfloat(&item2->value_list[0]) * position;
00238                         atom_setfloat(&newValue[0], value);
00239                 } else if(item1->type == ps_msg_toggle) {
00240                         value = position <= 0.5 ? atom_getlong(&item1->value) : atom_getlong(&item2->value);
00241                         atom_setlong(&newValue[0], value);
00242                 } else if(item1->type == ps_msg_list || item1->type == gensym("list_int") || item1->type == gensym("list_float")) {
00243                         for(int i = 0; i < item1->list_size; i++) {
00244                                 value = atom_getfloat(&item1->value_list[i]) * (1. - position) + atom_getfloat(&item2->value_list[i]) * position;
00245                                 atom_setfloat(&newValue[i], value);
00246                         }
00247                 } else if(item1->type == ps_msg_symbol) {
00248                         atom_setsym(&newValue[0], position <= 0.5 ? atom_getsym(&item1->value) : atom_getsym(&item2->value));
00249                 }
00250                 hub_symbol(x, item1->param_name, item1->list_size, &newValue[0]);
00251                         
00252         }
00253         
00254 }
00255 
00256 void hub_preset_interpolate(t_hub *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00257 {
00258         t_preset *p1, *p2;
00259         presetList *presetll = x->preset;
00260         t_symbol *p1Name, *p2Name;
00261         float position;
00262         
00263         if(argc < 3) {
00264                 error("jcom.hub (%s module): interpolation requires three arguments", x->attr_name);
00265                 return;
00266         }
00267 
00268         p1Name = atom_getsym(argv); p2Name = atom_getsym(argv+1);
00269         position = atom_getfloat(argv+2);
00270         
00271         p1 = find_preset(presetll, p1Name);
00272         if(!p1) {
00273                 error("can't find preset %s", p1Name);
00274                 return;
00275         }
00276         
00277         p2 = find_preset(presetll, p2Name);
00278         if(!p2) {
00279                 error("can't find preset %s", p1Name);
00280                 return;
00281         }
00282         
00283         interpolate_presets(x, p1, p2, position);
00284         
00285 }
00286 
00287 void hub_preset_store(t_hub *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)         // number & optional name
00288 {
00289         long                    preset_num = 0;
00290         t_symbol                *preset_name = NULL;
00291         presetList              *preset = x->preset;
00292         presetItemList  *item;
00293         t_preset_item   *newItem = NULL;
00294         subscriberList  *subscriber;            // used for traversing parameters to get their names and values
00295         t_atom                  *av;                                    // used for return values from attribute queries
00296         long                    ac;                                             // ...
00297         
00298         if(argc < 1){
00299                 // write over the last preset recalled
00300                         
00301                 if(preset->empty()) {
00302                         error("jcom.hub (%s module): no preset specified active", x->attr_name);
00303                         return;
00304                 }
00305                 // Recall the number of the preset we recalled last     
00306                 preset_num = (*(preset->begin()))->last_preset_num;
00307                 // Recall the name as well
00308                 preset_name = (*(preset->begin()))->last_preset_name;
00309         } else {
00310         
00311                 if(argv->a_type != A_LONG){
00312                         error("jcom.hub (%s module): first argument must be an int if a name is specified", x->attr_name);
00313                         return;
00314                 }
00315                 
00316                 preset_num = atom_getlong(argv);
00317                 if(argc > 1)
00318                         preset_name = atom_getsym(argv+1);
00319                 else
00320                         preset_name = symbol_unique();
00321         }
00322         
00323         // Search the linked list for this preset (if it already exists) and remove it
00324         //      also remove any items that are members of the preset
00325         presetListIterator pIter;
00326         presetItemListIterator itemIterator;
00327         t_preset* p;
00328         /*
00329         pIter = preset->begin();
00330         if(!preset->empty())
00331                 pIter = preset->find_if(preset->begin(), preset->end(), presetByNumber(*pIter, preset_num));
00332         if(pIter != preset->end()) {
00333         */
00334         for(pIter = preset->begin(); pIter != preset->end(); ++pIter) {
00335                 p = *pIter;
00336                 if(p->number == preset_num) {
00337                         item = p->item;
00338                         // Free the parameters this preset contains
00339                         for(itemIterator = item->begin(); itemIterator != item->end(); ++itemIterator) {
00340                                 sysmem_freeptr(*itemIterator);
00341                                 itemIterator = item->erase(itemIterator);
00342                         }
00343                         delete item;
00344                         // Free the preset itself
00345                         sysmem_freeptr(p);
00346                         // Remove from linked list
00347                         pIter = preset->erase(pIter);
00348                 }
00349         }
00350         
00351         
00352         // Allocate the slot for this preset, and store the data
00353         p = (t_preset *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_preset));
00354         p->number = preset_num;
00355         p->name = preset_name;
00356         // If there are no presets yet don't mess up the list
00357         if(!x->preset->empty()) {
00358                 // Store the number of the preset we recalled last in the first preset (the one being recalled now)
00359                 (*(x->preset->begin()))->last_preset_num = preset_num;
00360                 // Store the name as well
00361                 (*(x->preset->begin()))->last_preset_name = preset_name;
00362         }
00363         /* XXX Probably also need to delete this in hub_free() when deleting a preset */
00364         p->item = new presetItemList;                   // start with no items in the preset
00365 
00366         // Allocate the items for this preset (by traversing all parameters)
00367         subscriber = x->subscriber;
00368         subscriberIterator i;
00369         t_subscriber* t;
00370         for(i = subscriber->begin(); i != subscriber->end(); ++i) {
00371                 t = *i;
00372                 if(t->type == ps_subscribe_parameter){
00373                         newItem = (t_preset_item *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_preset_item));
00374                         newItem->param_name = t->name;
00375 
00376                         ac = NULL; av = NULL;                                                                                           // init
00377                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object, ps_type, &ac, &av);           // get
00378                         newItem->type = atom_getsym(av);                                                                                // copy
00379 
00380                         ac = NULL; av = NULL;                                                                                           // init
00381                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object, ps_priority, &ac, &av);       // get
00382                         newItem->priority = atom_getlong(av);                                                                   // copy
00383                         
00384                         ac = NULL; av = NULL;                                                                                           // init
00385                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object, ps_value, &ac, &av);          // get
00386                         sysmem_copyptr(av, &newItem->value_list[0], sizeof(t_atom) * ac);
00387                         newItem->list_size = ac;
00388                         
00389                         p->item->push_back(newItem);
00390                 }
00391         }
00392                                 
00393         preset->merge(p, presetIsLess);
00394         if(x->preset->size() == 1) {
00395                 // If there is only 1 preset it's possible it was the first one added, in which case
00396                 // we need to ensure that the first preset has the last preset number and name saved as well
00397                 (*(x->preset->begin()))->last_preset_num = preset_num;
00398                 (*(x->preset->begin()))->last_preset_name = preset_name;
00399         }
00400         critical_exit(0);       
00401         hub_preset_buildmenu(x);
00402 }
00403 
00404 void hub_preset_store_next(t_hub *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)    
00405 {
00406         t_atom b[2];
00407         atom_setlong(&b[0], x->preset->size() + 1);
00408         atom_setsym(&b[1], atom_getsym(argv));
00409         hub_preset_store(x, gensym("/preset/store"), 2, b);
00410 }

00412 // read the default file and recall the first preset
00413 void hub_preset_default(t_hub *x, t_symbol*, long, t_atom*)
00414 {
00415         char    default_file_name[256];
00416         t_atom  a;
00417         
00418         strcpy(default_file_name, x->attr_name->s_name);
00419         strcat(default_file_name, ".xml");
00420         
00421         atom_setlong(&a, 1);
00422 
00423         hub_preset_doread(x, gensym(default_file_name));
00424         hub_preset_recall(x, _sym_nothing, 1, &a);
00425 }

00430 //void hub_preset_read(t_hub *x, t_symbol *userpath)
00431 void hub_preset_read(t_hub *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00432 {
00433         t_symbol        *userpath;
00434 
00435         if(argc)
00436                 userpath = atom_getsym(argv);
00437         else
00438                 userpath = _sym_nothing;
00439 
00440         defer_low(x, (method)hub_preset_doread, userpath, 0, 0L);
00441 }
00442 
00443 
00444 void hub_preset_doread(t_hub *x, t_symbol *userpath)
00445 {
00446         char                    filename[256];                  // for storing the name of the file locally
00447         char                    fullpath[512];                  // path and name passed on to the xml parser
00448         short                   path;                                   // pathID#
00449         long                    outtype;                                // the file type that is actually true
00450 
00451         // FIND THE FILE WE WANT TO READ
00452         if(!userpath->s_name[0]){                                                                                                       // Empty string
00453                 if(open_dialog(filename, &path, &outtype ,NULL, -1))                    // Returns 0 if successful
00454                         return;                                                                                                         // User Cancelled
00455         }
00456         else{
00457                 strcpy(filename, userpath->s_name);                                                                     // Copy symbol argument to a local string
00458                 if(locatefile_extended(filename, &path, &outtype, NULL, -1)){   // Returns 0 if successful
00459                         if(x->attr_name != gensym("/editing_this_module"))
00460                                 error("jcom.hub (%s module): preset file not found", x->attr_name->s_name);
00461                         return;                                                                                                         // Not found
00462                 }       
00463         }
00464 
00465         jcom_core_getfilepath(path, filename, fullpath);
00466         //post("path for xml preset file: %s", temppath);
00467         hub_preset_parse(x, fullpath);
00468         hub_preset_buildmenu(x);
00469 }
00470 
00471 
00472 int coerceType(const char* s)
00473 {
00474         // Is the first char a digit?
00475         if(isdigit(s[0])){
00476                 // It's not a symbol, so is it an int or a float?
00477                 if(strchr(s, '.'))  // First char is a digit and s contains a ., consider it a float
00478                         return A_FLOAT;
00479                 else
00480                         return A_LONG;  // No decimal point, so treat it as an int
00481         }
00482         else if(s[0] == '-'){
00483                 if(strlen(s) > 1){
00484                         if(isdigit(s[1])){
00485                                 if(strchr(s, '.'))      // First char is a digit and s contains a ., consider it a float
00486                                         return A_FLOAT;
00487                                 else
00488                                         return A_LONG;          // No decimal point, so treat it as an int                              
00489                         }
00490                 }
00491         }
00492         return A_SYM; // Not a float, not an int, must be a symbol
00493 }
00494 
00495 
00496 // Actually read and parse the XML file for a preset
00497 void hub_preset_parse(t_hub *x, char *path)
00498 {
00499         xmlTextReaderPtr        reader = NULL;
00500         int                                     ret = 0;
00501         const xmlChar           *element_name = 0,
00502                                                 *name = 0, 
00503                                                 *number = 0, 
00504                                                 *val = 0;
00505         presetList                      *presetLL = x->preset;
00506         t_preset                        *preset = NULL;                 // the current preset we are parsing
00507         t_preset_item           *item = NULL;                   // the current preset item we are parsing
00508         const xmlChar           *type = 0;                              // data type of the current preset item
00509         const xmlChar           *priority = 0;
00510         int                             preset_num = 0;                 // temporary holder
00511         short                           result = 0;
00512         bool                            item_opened = false;    // is there currently an item open for writing?
00513         
00514         LIBXML_TEST_VERSION                                                     // init the library
00515 
00516         // 1. Check the file before we try to use it
00517         if(hub_preset_validate(x, path) != 0)
00518                 return;
00519         
00520         // 2. Read and parse the file
00521         reader = xmlReaderForFile(path, NULL, 0);
00522 
00523         if(reader != NULL){
00524                 hub_presets_clear(x, NULL, 0, NULL);
00525                 ret = xmlTextReaderRead(reader);
00526                 
00527                 presetListIterator pli = presetLL->begin();
00528                 critical_enter(0);
00529 
00530                 while(ret==1){
00531                         element_name = xmlTextReaderConstName(reader);
00532                         if(element_name == NULL)
00533                                 return;
00534                         
00535                         if(!strcmp((char *)element_name, "preset")){
00536                                 if(xmlTextReaderNodeType(reader) == 1){                         // element start
00537                                         number = xmlTextReaderGetAttribute(reader, (xmlChar *)"number");
00538                                         //post("PRESET: %s - %s", (char *)xmlTextReaderGetAttribute(reader, (xmlChar *)"number"), (char *)xmlTextReaderGetAttribute(reader, (xmlChar *)"name"));
00539                                         //sscanf((char *)xmlTextReaderGetAttribute(reader, (xmlChar *)"number"), "%i", &preset_num);
00540                                         sscanf((const char *)number, "%i", &preset_num);
00541 
00542                                         preset = (t_preset *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_preset));
00543                                         preset->number = preset_num;
00544                                         name = xmlTextReaderGetAttribute(reader, (xmlChar *)"name");
00545                                         //preset->name = gensym((char *)xmlTextReaderGetAttribute(reader, (xmlChar *)"name"));
00546                                         preset->name = gensym((char *)name);
00547                                         preset->item = new presetItemList;      
00548         
00549                                         xmlFree((void *)number);
00550                                         number = NULL;
00551                                         xmlFree((void *)name);
00552                                         name = NULL;
00553                                 }
00554                                 else if(xmlTextReaderNodeType(reader) == 15){           // element close
00555                                         //post("PRESET CLOSING: %s", (char *)xmlTextReaderGetAttribute(reader, (xmlChar *)"number"));
00556                                         presetLL->merge(preset, presetIsLess);
00557                                 }
00558                         }
00559 
00560                         if(!strcmp((char *)element_name, "item")){
00561                                 if(xmlTextReaderNodeType(reader) == 1){                         // element start
00562                                         item_opened = true;
00563                                         //post("   ITEM: %s", (char *)xmlTextReaderGetAttribute(reader, (xmlChar *)"name"));
00564                                         item = (t_preset_item *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_preset_item));
00565                                         name = xmlTextReaderGetAttribute(reader, (xmlChar *)"name");
00566                                         item->param_name = gensym((char *)name);
00567                                         type = xmlTextReaderGetAttribute(reader, (xmlChar *)"type");
00568                                         if(type != NULL)
00569                                                 item->type = gensym((char *)type);
00570                                         else
00571                                                 item->type = ps_msg_generic;
00572                                         priority = xmlTextReaderGetAttribute(reader, (xmlChar *)"priority");
00573                                         if(priority)
00574                                                 sscanf((char *)priority, "%ld", &item->priority);
00575                                         else
00576                                                 item->priority = 0;
00577                                         xmlFree((void *)name);
00578                                         name = NULL;
00579                                         xmlFree((void *)type);
00580                                         type = NULL;
00581                                         /* XXX should we also be calling xmlFree(reader, (xmlChar*)"priority") right here? */
00582                                         xmlFree((void*)priority); 
00583                                         priority = NULL;
00584                                 }
00585                                 else if(xmlTextReaderNodeType(reader) == 15){           // element close
00586                                         preset->item->push_back(item);
00587                                         item_opened = false;
00588                                 }
00589                         }
00590 
00591                         if(xmlTextReaderNodeType(reader) == XML_TEXT_NODE){
00592                                 val = xmlTextReaderConstValue(reader);
00593                                 if((val != NULL) && (item_opened)){
00594                                         float   temp_float = 0;
00595                                         long    temp_int = 0;
00596                 
00597                                         if(item->type == ps_msg_symbol){
00598                                                 //post("Symbol! %s", (char *)value);
00599                                                 atom_setsym(&item->value, gensym((char *)val));         // assume symbol        
00600                                                 item->list_size = 1;
00601                                         }
00602                                         else if((item->type == ps_msg_int) || (item->type == ps_msg_toggle)){
00603                                                 result = sscanf((char *)val, "%ld", &temp_int);         // try to get long
00604                                                 if(result > 0){
00605                                                         //post("Int! %i", temp_int, result);
00606                                                         atom_setlong(&item->value, temp_int);                                   
00607                                                         item->list_size = 1;
00608                                                 }
00609                                         } 
00610                                         else {                                                  // (msg_list, msg_generic, a list or not specified)
00611                                                 char *sep = " ";
00612                                                 char *element;
00613                                                 int i = item->list_size = 0;
00614 
00615                                                 for(element = strtok((char*)val, sep); element; element = strtok(NULL, sep), i++) {
00616                                                         switch(coerceType(element))
00617                                                         {
00618                                                                 case A_LONG:
00619                                                                         if(sscanf(element, "%ld", &temp_int)) {
00620                                                                                 atom_setlong(&item->value_list[i], temp_int);
00621                                                                                 item->list_size += 1;
00622                                                                         }
00623                                                                         break;
00624                                                                 case A_FLOAT:
00625                                                                         if(sscanf(element, "%f", &temp_float)) {
00626                                                                                 atom_setfloat(&item->value_list[i], temp_float);
00627                                                                                 item->list_size += 1;
00628                                                                         }
00629                                                                         break;
00630                                                                 case A_SYM:
00631                                                                         atom_setsym(&item->value_list[i], gensym((char*)element));
00632                                                                         item->list_size += 1;                                                   
00633                                                                         break;
00634                                                                 default:
00635                                                                         error("Unable to determine data type");
00636                                                                         break;
00637                                                         }
00638                                                 }
00639                                         }
00640                                 }
00641                         }                       
00642                         ret = xmlTextReaderRead(reader);
00643                 }
00644                 xmlFreeTextReader(reader);
00645                 if(ret != 0){
00646                         error("%s: failed to parse", path);
00647                 }
00648                 critical_exit(0);
00649         }
00650         else{
00651                 error("Unable to open %s", path);
00652         }
00653 }
00654 
00655 
00656 // Given a path, validate the xml file
00657 short hub_preset_validate(t_hub *x, char *xml_path)
00658 {
00659         char                                    filename[256];                  // for storing the name of the file locally
00660         char                                    fullpath[512];                  // path and name passed on to the xml parser
00661         short                                   path = 0;                               // pathID#
00662         long                                    outtype = 0;                    // the file type that is actually true
00663         xmlDocPtr                               schema_doc = NULL;
00664         xmlSchemaParserCtxtPtr  parser_context = NULL;
00665         xmlSchemaPtr                    schema = NULL;
00666         xmlSchemaValidCtxtPtr   context = NULL;
00667         xmlDocPtr                               document = NULL;
00668         short                                   result = 0;
00669         
00670         // 1. Find the XML Schema file
00671         strcpy(filename, "jamoma.xsd");
00672         if(locatefile_extended(filename, &path, &outtype, NULL, -1)){
00673                 error("jcom.hub (%s module): jamoma.xsd schema file not found", x->attr_name->s_name);
00674                 return -1;
00675         }       
00676         jcom_core_getfilepath(path, filename, fullpath);
00677 
00678         // 2. Actually validate the XML file using the schema...
00679         //schema_doc = xmlReadFile("/Users/tim/Developer/_electrotap/Jamoma/library/jamoma.xsd", NULL, 0);
00680         schema_doc = xmlReadFile(fullpath, NULL, 0);
00681         if(schema_doc == NULL){
00682                 error("jcom.hub: preset validation could not open schema doc");
00683                 goto out;
00684         }
00685 
00686         parser_context = xmlSchemaNewDocParserCtxt(schema_doc);
00687         if(schema_doc == NULL){
00688                 error("jcom.hub: preset validation could not create parser for schema doc");
00689                 goto out;
00690         }
00691 
00692         schema = xmlSchemaParse(parser_context);
00693         if(schema_doc == NULL){
00694                 error("jcom.hub: preset validation could not create representation of schema in memory");
00695                 goto out;
00696         }
00697 
00698         context = xmlSchemaNewValidCtxt(schema);
00699         if(context == NULL){
00700                 error("jcom.hub: preset validation failed to create a context");
00701                 goto out;
00702         }
00703 
00704         document = xmlReadFile(xml_path, NULL, 0);
00705         if(document == NULL){
00706                 error("jcom.hub: preset validation could not open the preset file");
00707                 goto out;
00708         }
00709 
00710         result = xmlSchemaValidateDoc(context, document);       
00711         if(result){
00712                 error("jcom.hub: preset file FAILED xml schema validation");
00713         }
00714 
00715 out:            
00716         xmlFreeDoc(document);
00717         xmlSchemaFreeValidCtxt(context);
00718         xmlSchemaFree(schema);
00719         xmlSchemaFreeParserCtxt(parser_context);
00720         xmlFreeDoc(schema_doc);
00721         
00722         return result;
00723 }
00724 
00725 
00726 // Erase all presets from memory
00727 void hub_presets_clear(t_hub *x, t_symbol*, long, t_atom*)
00728 {
00729         presetList              *presetList = x->preset;
00730         presetItemList  *itemList;
00731         presetItemListIterator  nextItem;
00732         presetListIterator pli;
00733         t_preset *thePreset;    
00734 
00735         critical_enter(0);      
00736         while(!presetList->empty()) {
00737                 pli = presetList->begin();
00738                 thePreset = *pli;
00739                 itemList = thePreset->item;  // The list of items in the preset
00740                 // Delete all the items in the preset
00741                 while(!itemList->empty()) {
00742                         nextItem = itemList->begin();
00743                         sysmem_freeptr(*nextItem);
00744                         itemList->remove(nextItem);
00745                 }
00746                 delete itemList;
00747                 // Free the preset itself
00748                 sysmem_freeptr(thePreset);
00749                 // Remove from list
00750                 presetList->remove(pli);
00751         }
00752         critical_exit(0);
00753 }

00756 // dump the preset info to the Max window for debugging
00757 void hub_presets_dump(t_hub *x, t_symbol*, long, t_atom*)
00758 {
00759         presetList              *preset = x->preset;
00760         presetItemList  *item;
00761 
00762         post("");
00763         post("PRESET DUMP");
00764         post("");
00765         
00766         presetListIterator i;
00767         presetItemListIterator itemIterator;
00768         t_preset *p;
00769         t_preset_item *presetItem;
00770         critical_enter(0);
00771         for(i = preset->begin(); i != preset->end(); ++i) {
00772                 p = *i;
00773                 post("  PRESET %i: %s", p->number, p->name->s_name);
00774                 item = p->item;
00775                 for(itemIterator = item->begin(); itemIterator != item->end(); ++itemIterator) {
00776                         presetItem = *itemIterator;
00777                         if((presetItem->type == ps_msg_int) || (presetItem->type == ps_msg_toggle))
00778                                 post("    %s (type %s, priority %i): %ld", presetItem->param_name->s_name,
00779                                         presetItem->type->s_name, presetItem->priority, atom_getlong(&(presetItem->value)));
00780                         else if(presetItem->type == ps_msg_symbol)
00781                                 post("    %s (type %s, priority %i): %s", presetItem->param_name->s_name,
00782                                         presetItem->type->s_name, presetItem->priority, 
00783                                         atom_getsym(&(presetItem->value))->s_name);
00784                         else
00785                                 post("    %s (type %s, priority %i): %f", presetItem->param_name->s_name, 
00786                                         presetItem->type->s_name, presetItem->priority, atom_getfloat(&(presetItem->value)));
00787                 }               
00788         }
00789         critical_exit(0);
00790 }

00792 
00793 void hub_preset_write(t_hub *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00794 {
00795         t_symbol        *userpath;
00796 
00797         if(argc)
00798                 userpath = atom_getsym(argv);
00799         else
00800                 userpath = _sym_nothing;
00801 
00802         if(x->preset->empty()){ // no presets have been stored, so store the current state as the default
00803                 t_atom  a[2];
00804 
00805                 atom_setlong(&a[0], 1);
00806                 atom_setsym(&a[1], ps_default);
00807                 hub_preset_store(x, gensym("/preset/store"), 2, a);
00808         } else {
00809                 // recall the number of the preset we recalled last in the first preset (the one being recalled now)
00810                 long num = (*(x->preset->begin()))->last_preset_num;
00811                 // recall the name as well
00812                 t_symbol *name = (*(x->preset->begin()))->last_preset_name;
00813                 t_atom b[2];
00814                 atom_setlong(&b[0], num);
00815                 atom_setsym(&b[1], name);
00816                 hub_preset_store(x, gensym("/preset/store"), 2, b);
00817         }
00818         
00819         defer_low(x, (method)hub_preset_dowrite, userpath, 0, 0L);
00820 }
00821 
00822 void writeList(t_filehandle *fh, long *eof, t_preset_item *item)
00823 {
00824         char tempstring[512];
00825         long len, err;
00826         t_symbol* sym;
00827         len = err = 0;
00828         
00829         // write name and type
00830         snprintf(tempstring, sizeof(tempstring), "    <item name='%s' type='%s' priority='%ld'>",
00831                 item->param_name->s_name, item->type->s_name, item->priority);
00832         len = strlen(tempstring);
00833         sysfile_write(*fh, &len, tempstring);
00834         *eof += len;
00835         
00836         for(int i = 0; i < item->list_size; i++) {
00837                 switch(item->value_list[i].a_type) 
00838                 {
00839                         case A_SYM:
00840                                 sym = atom_getsym(&item->value_list[i]);
00841                                 snprintf(tempstring, sizeof(tempstring), "%s ", sym->s_name);
00842                                 break;
00843                         case A_FLOAT:
00844                                 snprintf(tempstring, sizeof(tempstring), "%f ", atom_getfloat(&item->value_list[i]));
00845                                 break;
00846                         case A_LONG:
00847                                 snprintf(tempstring, sizeof(tempstring), "%ld ", atom_getlong(&item->value_list[i]));
00848                                 break;
00849                 }
00850                 len = strlen(tempstring);
00851                 sysfile_write(*fh, &len, tempstring);
00852                 *eof += len;
00853                 
00854         }
00855         strncpy(tempstring, "</item>\n", sizeof(tempstring) - 1);
00856         len = strlen(tempstring);
00857         sysfile_write(*fh, &len, tempstring);
00858         *eof += len;
00859 }
00860 
00861 void hub_preset_dowrite(t_hub *x, t_symbol *userpath)
00862 {
00863         long                    type = 'TEXT';                          // four-char code for Mac file type
00864         char                    filename[256];                          // for storing the name of the file locally
00865         short                   path, err;                                      // pathID#, error number
00866         long                    outtype;                                        // the file type that is actually true
00867         t_filehandle    file_handle;                            // a reference to our file (for opening it, closing it, etc.)
00868         long                    myEof = 0;
00869         char                    tempstring[1024];
00870         presetList              *preset = x->preset;            // the head of the linked list
00871         presetItemList  *item = NULL;                           // for accessing items of the preset
00872         t_symbol                *result;
00873 
00874         // SPECIFY THE FILE WE WANT TO WRITE
00875         if(!userpath->s_name[0]){                                                                                               // Empty string - Throw up a dialog
00876                 sprintf(filename, "%s.xml", x->attr_name->s_name);                                      // Default File Name
00877                 saveas_promptset("Save Preset...");                                                                     // Instructional Text in the dialog
00878                 err = saveasdialog_extended(filename, &path, &outtype, &type, 1);       // Returns 0 if successful
00879                 if(err)                                                                                                                         // User Cancelled
00880                         return;                                                                                                                 
00881         }
00882         else{
00883                 strcpy(filename, userpath->s_name);                                                                     // Copy symbol argument to a local string
00884                 path = 0;               
00885         }
00886 
00887         // NOW ATTEMPT TO CREATE THE FILE...
00888         err = path_createsysfile(filename, path, type, &file_handle);
00889         if(err){                                                                                                                                // Handle any errors that occur
00890                 error("jcom.hub: %s - error %d creating file", filename, err);
00891                 return; 
00892         }
00893 
00894         // HERE WE CAN FINALLY WRITE THE DATA OUT TO THE FILE
00895         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "<?xml version='1.0' encoding='iso-8859-1' standalone='yes' ?>");
00896         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "");
00897         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "<jamoma version='0.4'");
00898         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "                xmlns:xsi='http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance'");
00899         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "                xsi:schemaLocation='http://jamoma.org/ file:jamoma.xsd'");
00900         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, ">");
00901 
00902         // Process each preset
00903         presetListIterator i;
00904         presetItemListIterator itemIterator;
00905         t_preset* p;
00906         t_preset_item *presetItem;
00907         preset = x->preset;     // head of the list of presets
00908         critical_enter(0);
00909         for(i = preset->begin(); i != preset->end(); ++i) {
00910                 p = *i;
00911                 sprintf(tempstring, "  <preset number='%ld' name='%s'>", p->number, p->name->s_name);
00912                 jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00913 
00914                 // Process each item in the preset
00915                 item = p->item;
00916                 for(itemIterator = item->begin(); itemIterator != item->end(); ++itemIterator) {
00917                         presetItem = *itemIterator;
00918                         if(presetItem->list_size > 1) {
00919                                 writeList(&file_handle, &myEof, presetItem);                            
00920                         } else {
00921                                 if(presetItem->value.a_type == A_SYM){
00922                                         result = atom_getsym(&(presetItem->value));
00923                                         sprintf(tempstring, "    <item name='%s' type='%s' priority='%ld'>%s</item>",
00924                                                 presetItem->param_name->s_name, presetItem->type->s_name, 
00925                                                 presetItem->priority, result->s_name);
00926                                 }
00927                                 else if(presetItem->value.a_type == A_FLOAT)
00928                                         sprintf(tempstring, "    <item name='%s' type='%s' priority='%ld'>%f</item>",
00929                                                 presetItem->param_name->s_name, presetItem->type->s_name, presetItem->priority,
00930                                                 atom_getfloat(&(presetItem->value)));
00931                                 else if(presetItem->value.a_type == A_LONG)
00932                                         sprintf(tempstring, "    <item name='%s' type='%s' priority='%ld'>%ld</item>",
00933                                                 presetItem->param_name->s_name, presetItem->type->s_name, presetItem->priority,
00934                                                 atom_getlong(&(presetItem->value)));
00935                                 
00936                                 jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00937                         }
00938                 }
00939                 
00940                 jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "  </preset>");
00941         }
00942         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "</jamoma>");
00943         critical_exit(0);
00944         
00945         // WE ARE DONE, SO CLOSE THE FILE
00946         err = sysfile_seteof(file_handle, myEof);
00947         if(err){
00948                 error("jcom.hub: %s - error %d creating EOF", filename, err);
00949                 return; 
00950         }
00951                                                         
00952         sysfile_close(file_handle);             // close file reference
00953         post("Jamoma: /preset/write completed successfully");
00954 }
00955 
00956 
00957 // Communicate with the gui to build the preset listing in the module menu
00958 void hub_preset_buildmenu(t_hub *x)
00959 {
00960         presetList              *preset = x->preset;
00961         t_atom                  a[3];
00962 
00963         if(x->gui_object != NULL){
00964                 atom_setsym(&a[0], ps_NEW_PRESETS_START);
00965                 object_method_typed(x->gui_object, ps_dispatched, 1, a, NULL);
00966                 
00967                 presetListIterator i;
00968                 t_preset *p;
00969                 for(i = preset->begin(); i != preset->end(); ++i) {
00970                         p = *i;
00971                         atom_setsym(&a[0], ps_NEW_PRESETS);
00972                         atom_setsym(&a[1], p->name);
00973                         object_method_typed(x->gui_object, ps_dispatched, 2, a, NULL);
00974                 }
00975 
00976                 atom_setsym(&a[0], ps_MENU_REBUILD);            
00977                 object_method_typed(x->gui_object, ps_dispatched, 1, a, NULL);
00978         }
00979 }
